question.title: How to create my MCP server using mcp.io Java sdk?
question.body:
I am trying to write a MCP server using the plain Java SDK from modelcontextprotocol.io (no Spring).

class MyMcpServer {
  public static McpSyncServer create() {
    var provider =
      HttpServletSseServerTransportProvider
        .builder()
        .messageEndpoint("/msg")
        .build()

    var capabilities =
      ServerCapabilities
        .builder()
        .tools(true)
        .prompts(true)
        .resources(false, true) // resource support off but keep listChanged notifications true/false as needed
        .logging() // optional: structured logging support
        .completions() // optional: prompt/resource completions
        .build()

    return McpServer
      .sync(provider)
      .serverInfo("scala-docs-mcp", "1.0.0")
      .capabilities(capabilities)
      .tools(calcularTool())
      .build()
  }
}

Question is how to get the above server hosted on /msg path. I understand that it would have to be hosted in a servelet or the sort. But I can't find anything related to servlet or the like in the MCP.io apis.

The official documentation is of very little help. Hope the community can help me out.
